member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AccessModes
member.summary: Specifies the mode for locking or accessing a VISA resource.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AccessModes.NoLock
member.summary: Does not obtain any lock on the VISA resource.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AccessModes.ExclusiveLock
member.summary: Obtains an exclusive lock on the VISA resource.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AccessModes.SharedLock
member.summary: Obtains a lock on the VISA resource, which may be shared between multiple VISA sessions.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AccessModes.LoadConfig
member.summary: Opens a session with the ability to configure attributes to values specified by an external configuration utility.

member.summary: Program non-privileged access.

member.summary: Block privileged access.

member.summary: Block non-privileged access.

member.summary: D64 privileged access.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AccessPrivilege.D64Nonprivileged

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AddressState
member.summary: Specifies the address state of a GPIB interface.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AddressState.Unaddressed
member.summary: The GPIB interface is not addressed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AddressState.Talker
member.summary: The GPIB interface is addressed as a talker.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AddressState.Listener
member.summary: The GPIB interface is addressed as a listener.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AtnMode
member.summary: Specifies how to control the GPIB Attention (ATN) line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AtnMode.Deassert
member.summary: Deasserts the ATN line. The GPIB interface that corresponds to the VISA session switches to standby mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AtnMode.Assert
member.summary: Asserts the ATN line and takes control synchronously without corrupting transferred data. If a data handshake is in progress, the ATN line is not asserted until the handshake is complete.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AtnMode.DeassertHandshake
member.summary: Deasserts the ATN line and enters the shadow handshake mode. The local device participates in data handshakes as an acceptor without actually reading the data. The GPIB interface that corresponds to the VISA session switches to standby mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AtnMode.AssertImmediate
member.summary: Asserts the ATN line and takes control asynchronously and immediately, without regard for any data transfer currently in progress. You should use this member only for error conditions.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType
member.summary: Specifies the .NET interface to NI-VISA driver-level attributes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.RsrcClass
member.summary: The resource class, such as INSTR, as defined by the canonical resource name.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.RsrcName
member.summary: The unique identifier for a resource.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.RsrcImplVersion
member.summary: The resource version that uniquely identifies each of the different revisions or implementations of a resource.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.RsrcLockState
member.summary: The current locking state of the resource.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.MaxQueueLength
member.summary: The maximum number of events that can be queued at any time on the session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.UserData
member.summary: The data used privately by the application for a particular session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.FdcChnl
member.summary: The Fast Data Channel (FDC) used to transfer the buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.FdcMode
member.summary: The Fast Data Channel (FDC) mode to use (either normal or stream mode).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.FdcGenSignalEn
member.summary: This value corresponds to the VI_ATTR_FDC_GEN_SIGNAL_EN attribute on the NI-VISA driver.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.FdcUsePair
member.summary: This VISA attribute specifies whether one channel or a channel pair is used for transferring data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.SendEndEn
member.summary: This VISA attribute specifies whether to assert END during the transfer of the last byte of the buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.Termchar
member.summary: The termination character.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.TmoValue
member.summary: The minimum timeout value in milliseconds to use when accessing the device associated with the session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.GpibReaddrEn
member.summary: This VISA attribute specifies whether to use repeat addressing before each read or write operation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.IOProt
member.summary: The specified protocol to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.DmaAllowEn
member.summary: This VISA attribute specifies whether I/O accesses use DMA or Programmed I/O.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.AsrlBaud
member.summary: The baud rate of the interface.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.AsrlDataBits
member.summary: The number of data bits contained in each frame (from 5 to 8).

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.AsrlParity
member.summary: The parity used with every frame transmitted and received.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.AsrlStopBits
member.summary: The number of stop bits used to indicate the end of a frame.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.AsrlFlowCntrl
member.summary: The type of flow control used by the transfer mechanism.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.RdBufOperMode
member.summary: The operational mode of the formatted I/O read buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.WrBufOperMode
member.summary: The operational mode of the formatted I/O write buffer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.SuppresEndEn
member.summary: This VISA attribute specifies whether to suppress the END bit termination.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.TermcharEn
member.summary: A flag that determines whether the read operation terminates when a termination character is received.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.DestAccessPriv
member.summary: The address modifier used in high-level access operations, such as viOutXX() and viMoveOutXX(), when writing to the destination.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.DestByteOrder
member.summary: The byte order used in high-level access operations, such as viOutXX() and viMoveOutXX(), when writing to the destination.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.SrcAccessPriv
member.summary: The address modifier to use in high-level access operations, such as In and MoveIn, when reading from the source.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.SrcByteOrder
member.summary: The byte order to be used in high-level access operations, such as In and MoveIn, when reading from the source.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.SrcIncrement
member.summary: The number of elements that the source offset is to be incremented after every transfer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.DestIncrement
member.summary: The number of elements that the destination offset is incremented after every transfer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.WinAccessPriv
member.summary: The address modifier to use in low-level access operations, such as viMapAddress(), viPeekXX(), and viPokeXX(), when accessing the mapped window.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.AttributeType.WinByteOrder
member.summary: The byte order to use in low-level access operations, such as viMapAddress(), viPeekXX(), and viPokeXX(), when accessing the mapped window.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.FlowControlTypes
member.summary: Specifies the type of serial port flow control available for the transfer mechanism.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.FlowControlTypes.None
member.summary: The transfer mechanism does not use flow control. Buffers on both sides of the connection are assumed to be large enough to hold all transferred data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.FlowControlTypes.XOnXOff
member.summary: The transfer mechanism uses the XON and XOFF characters to perform flow control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.FlowControlTypes.RtsCts
member.summary: The transfer mechanism uses the Request To Send (RTS) output signal and the Clear To Send (CTS) input signal to perform flow control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.FlowControlTypes.DtrDsr
member.summary: The transfer mechanism uses the Data Terminal Ready (DTR) output signal and the Data Set Ready (DSR) input signal to perform flow control.

member.summary: All enabled events must be operated on.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialBreak
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when a break signal is received.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialAnyCharacterReceived
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when at least one data byte is received.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialClearToSend
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the Clear To Send (CTS) line changes state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialDataCarrierDetect
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the Data Carrier Detect (DCD) line changes state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialDataSetReady
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the Data Set Ready (DSR) line changes state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialRingIndicator
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the Ring Indicator (RI) input signal is asserted.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.SerialTerminationCharacterReceived
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the termination character is received.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.Clear
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the local controller is sent a device clear message.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.GpibControllerInCharge
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the GPIB controller gains or loses Controller-In-Charge (CIC) status.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.GpibListen
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the GPIB controller is addressed to listen.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.GpibTalk
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the GPIB controller is addressed to talk.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.IOCompletion
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when an asynchronous operation is complete.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.PxiInterrupt
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when a PXI interrupt occurs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.ServiceRequest
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when a service request is received from the device or interface associated with the session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.Trigger
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when a trigger interrupt is received from the device.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.VxiSignalProcessor
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when a VXIbus signal or VXIbus interrupt is received from the device associated with the session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.VxiVmeInterrupt
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when a VXIbus interrupt is received from the device associated with the session.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.VxiVmeSystemFail
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the VXI/VME SYSFAIL* line is asserted.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Internal.EventType.VxiVmeSystemReset
member.summary: The VISA event that occurs when the VXI/VME SYSRESET* line is asserted.

member.summary: Odd parity is used for transmits and receives.

member.summary: Even parity is used for transmits and receives.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Parity.Mark
member.summary: The parity bit exists and is always 1.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.Parity.Space
member.summary: The parity bit exists and is always 0.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.SerialTerminationMethod
member.summary: Specifies the available methods for terminating a serial transfer.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.SerialTerminationMethod.None
member.summary: The transfer terminates when all requested data is transferred or when an error occurs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.SerialTerminationMethod.LastBit
member.summary: The transfer occurs with the last bit not set until the last character is sent.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.SerialTerminationMethod.TerminationCharacter
member.summary: The transfers terminate by searching for "/" appending the termination character in MessageBasedSession TerminationCharacter or GpibInterface TerminationCharacter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.SerialTerminationMethod.Break
member.summary: The write transmits a break after all the characters for the write are sent.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.UsbTerminationMethod
member.summary: Specifies the available methods to terminate a read operation on the UsbRaw object.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.UsbTerminationMethod.None
member.summary: The read operation ignores short packets. Reads do not terminate until all of the requested data is received, or an error occurs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.UsbTerminationMethod.Short
member.summary: The read operation terminates on a short packet. Use this setting if the device terminates all read transfers with a short packet, including sending a zero (short) packet when the last data packet is full.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.VisaNS.UsbTerminationMethod.ShortOrCount
member.summary: The read operation terminates on a short packet or when it receives the requested count of data bytes. Use this setting if the device does not send zero packets.
